title: What sort of brains do fish have? - Quora

response.answer_text: The brain of the fish is very small compared to its body and is classified in five parts: The olfactory bulb and optic lobe are responsible for the sense of vision and smell. They are especially important for pretatorial fish like sharks and make up a large portion of the brain. It is necessary for survivial! Since the fish is a vertabrate, it has a cerebrum and cerebellum. The cerebrum manages voluntary movements and the cerebellum manages involuntary movements (mainly balancing). Unlike humans, fish use their cerebrum with simplicity and don’t think as complicated as humans. The pituitary manages glands and hormones. It is the chemical factory of the brain.
